As part of our online learning strategy, teachers will provide scholars \u201Clive\u201D lessons where the teacher is giving immediate feedback to scholars online. Unfortunately, some scholars may not be able to attend these \u201Clive\u201D lessons. To accommodate these scholars, we want to record the live lesson so that they can view at another time. These recordings will not be public. If you do not want your child recorded as part of the live lesson, please complete the OPT OUT FORM (English) or OPT OUT FORM (Somali) no later than April 22, 2020.
ALL HARVEST BEST ACADEMY SCHOLARS WILL RECEIVE A LAPTOP TO USE DURING THE SCHOOL CLOSURE.
LAPTOPS WILL ONLY BE DISTRIBUTED TO SCHOLARS WITH A SIGNED FAMILY TECHNOLOGY FORM.
Harvest Best Academy will be offering instruction via distance learning between March 30th and May 4th, 2020.
Please see the Distance Learning Plan for more information.
Harvest Best Academy Board of Directors will hold a special board meeting on April 20, 2020 from 5:00pm-6:00pm. This will be a remote meeting held through GoToMeeting.

div.p: Per Governor Walz's executive order, Harvest Best Academy is closed from March 18th to at least May 4th to slow the spread of COVID-19 (coronavirus). Harvest Best Academy will be offering instruction via distance learning. See the Distance Learning Plan for more information. If these dates change for school closings, families will be notified through robocalls, emails, and this website. Please check back here for the latest updates.

Harvest Best Academy recently purchased laptops for all scholars that attend our school to improve the distance learning experience during this school closure period. There will be a phased distribution of laptops to our scholars. First, we’ll distribute to middle school (5th-8th grade) scholars on April 9th, then to the rest of the grades on April 16th. Complete the Family Technology Agreement. Laptops will only be distributed to scholars with a signed family technology agreement from an authorized parent or guardian.

h3.a: Parent letter from executive director mahmoud 4/2/2020

div.p: See the attached parent letter from Mr. Mahmoud.

h3.a: Parent letter from executive director mahmoud 3/16/2020

div.p: See the attached parent letter from Mr. Mahmoud.

div.h3: Child care services for emergency/health professionals/essential workers
div.p: If you qualify as an essential worker per Governor Walz’s executive order and are in need of childcare, complete the form below.
FREE meals are provided by MPS to any child 18 years and younger at nearly 50 locations around the city while schools are closed due to COVID-19; see where these sites are and related information.

div.span: Best Academy, 1300 Olson Memorial Highway, Minneapolis, MN, 55411, United States
